original_title: City Scoop: Trump awed in meeting with Mamdani, and other top stories across NYC
english_summary: Federal immigration enforcement operations will escalate in New York City due to its sanctuary city policies, White House advisor Tom Homan announced on Tuesday. This follows the recent detention of nine people on Canal Street, where ICE agents reappeared on Saturday. However, President Trump stated he will not deploy the National Guard to assist, as they are needed more in other cities. This development occurred after a Friday meeting between President Trump and NYC Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani, where the two discussed city affairs. Separately, MTA officials reported on Wednesday that a thief stealing copper wires caused over 700 subway delays last month. The thefts, near the 149th Street-Grand Concourse station, disrupted the 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, and 6 lines during evening rush hours.
chinese_title: 纽约庇护政策引争议，联邦将加强移民执法
refined_chinese_news_report:
白宫顾问汤姆·霍曼 (Tom Homan) 周二宣布，联邦将加强在纽约市的移民执法行动，此举主要针对该市的“庇护城市”政策。在此声明发布前，移民与海关执法局 (ICE) 的执法人员已于上周六在曼哈顿坚尼街 (Canal Street) 拘留了九人。
尽管执法力度将加大，但美国总统特朗普表示，他不会派遣国民警卫队来协助行动，并称其他城市更需要他们。这一系列动态发生于上周五总统特朗普与纽约市新当选市长佐兰·马姆达尼 (Zohran Mamdani) 就城市事务会面之后。

original_title: Ex-UN diplomat talks human rights careers with Steinhardt class
english_summary: On Thursday, former United Nations diplomat David Chikvaidze spoke to an NYU Steinhardt human rights class, offering career advice to students aspiring to work in international affairs. The talk was part of a course focused on migration this year. Responding to student questions about securing jobs and internships, Chikvaidze acknowledged that the UN accepts only a small number of undergraduate interns and lacks a clear entry point for young people. He advised students to first clearly identify their desired position and then learn how to emphasize the personal strengths and interests that make them a strong candidate. With 36 years of experience, Chikvaidze encouraged students to focus intently on their goals while also celebrating small victories along the way, calling youth a "reservoir of talent, energy and enthusiasm."
chinese_title: 前联合国官员支招，如何进入国际组织
refined_chinese_news_report:
上周四，前联合国官员大卫·奇克瓦伊泽 (David Chikvaidze) 在纽约大学斯坦哈特学院的一堂人权课上发表演讲。他为有志于从事国际事务的学生提供了职业建议，该讲座也是一门关于移民问题课程的一部分。
针对学生关于求职和实习的提问，奇克瓦伊泽坦言，联合国只接收极少数的本科实习生，并且缺乏一个为年轻人设立的明确入职通道。他承认，对于年轻人来说，找到进入该组织的起点并不容易。
拥有36年经验的奇克瓦伊泽建议，学生应首先明确自己心仪的职位，然后学会如何突出个人优势和兴趣，以证明自己是强有力的候选人。他鼓励学生在专注于长远目标的同时，也要为过程中的小胜利而庆祝，并称年轻人是“才华、精力和热情的宝库”。

original_title: NYU Langone awarded ‘A’ in safety for 11th time
english_summary: NYU Langone Health has received an "A" grade for patient safety for the 11th consecutive time from The Leapfrog Group, a national nonprofit organization. This top rating, from the fall 2025 survey, applies to key facilities including Tisch Hospital in Manhattan, Kimmel Pavilion, and NYU Langone Hospital–Brooklyn. The "A" grade, which is the highest possible, was awarded to only 23% of hospitals in New York state, indicating a strong performance in preventing medical errors, injuries, and infections. In addition, the recently merged NYU Langone Hospital–Suffolk improved its safety grade from a "C" to a "B." This recognition of high-quality care comes as the health system continues to expand, having opened six new medical centers in Suffolk County this year and proposed an $83 million expansion for its emergency department in Kips Bay.
chinese_title: 纽约大学朗格尼健康，连续11次获A级评价
refined_chinese_news_report:
根据全国性非营利组织The Leapfrog Group发布的最新患者安全评级，纽约大学朗格尼健康 (NYU Langone Health) 连续第11次获得“A”级评价。此次最高评级基于2025年秋季的调查数据，涵盖了其在曼哈顿的Tisch医院、Kimmel Pavilion以及纽约大学朗格尼布鲁克林医院等核心医疗设施。
“A”级是该评级系统中的最高等级，代表医院在预防医疗差错、意外伤害和感染方面的出色表现。报告显示，在纽约州的所有医院中，仅有23%的医院达到了这一标准，显示了NYU朗格尼健康的领先水平。
此外，系统内新近合并的纽约大学朗格尼萨福克医院 (NYU Langone Hospital–Suffolk)，其安全评级也从“C”级显著提升至“B”级。在获得安全认可的同时，该医疗系统也在持续扩张，今年已在萨福克郡新开设了六家医疗中心。

original_title: Langone researchers find new way to detect nerve-killing head trauma
english_summary: Researchers at NYU Langone have discovered a potential method to predict the risk of chronic traumatic encephalopathy (CTE), a neurodegenerative disease from repeated head injuries that is currently only diagnosable after death. A September study from the NYU Grossman School of Medicine and the Langone Concussion Center used advanced computer analysis on brain scans from 169 former male football players. The study found that these players had wider and shallower brain grooves (sulci) compared to 54 healthy males, a difference that increased with the length of their athletic careers. Lead author Professor Hector Arciniega stated this could enable a comprehensive risk assessment for living patients. This breakthrough represents a major shift from only treating symptoms to potentially intervening before the disease worsens. Future research will also explore how social factors impact CTE diagnosis and treatment.
chinese_title: 纽约大学新发现，或可生前预测脑损伤
refined_chinese_news_report:
纽约大学朗格尼医学中心 (NYU Langone) 的研究人员发现了一种预测慢性创伤性脑病 (CTE) 风险的潜在方法。这种由反复头部受伤引起的神经退行性疾病，此前只能在患者去世后通过尸检确诊。
今年九月，纽约大学格罗斯曼医学院和朗格尼脑震荡中心发表了一项研究。研究团队通过计算机分析了169名前橄榄球运动员的脑部扫描，发现他们的大脑沟回（sulci）比54名健康男性更宽、更浅，且这种差异随着运动员职业生涯的延长而增大。
研究的主要作者赫克托·阿尔西涅加 (Hector Arciniega) 教授表示，这一发现为在世患者进行全面的风险评估提供了可能。这标志着一个重大转变，即从仅治疗症状转向在病情恶化前进行干预。未来的研究还将探索社会因素对CTE诊断和治疗的影响。

original_title: COVID-19 may affect sense of smell for years, Langone study finds
english_summary: A new study from NYU Langone Health reveals that individuals may suffer from a long-term, reduced sense of smell after a COVID-19 infection, often without realizing it. Researchers surveyed over 3,500 participants for nearly four years using a scratch-and-sniff test. The study found that a significant number of people who believed their sense of smell was normal after having COVID-19 actually had "abnormally low" scores. Specifically, of the patients who reported no issues, 66% were found to have a smelling deficiency, known as hyposmia. Co-lead author and Grossman professor Leora Horwitz warned that this unnoticed loss poses safety risks, such as the inability to detect gas leaks, smoke, or spoiled food, and can also lead to malnourishment. Researchers now recommend that doctors screen long-term COVID-19 patients with smell tests, even if they do not report any symptoms.
chinese_title: 新冠后遗症新发现，嗅觉受损或不自知
refined_chinese_news_report:
纽约大学朗格尼健康中心 (NYU Langone Health) 的一项新研究显示，许多人在感染新冠后会遭受长期的嗅觉减退，但自己却并未察觉。这项历时近四年的研究对超过3500名参与者进行了“刮擦闻味”测试，结果发现，在那些自认为嗅觉完全正常的康复者中，有相当一部分人的测试得分“异常偏低”。
研究具体指出，在声称自己嗅觉没有问题的患者中，高达66%的人被诊断出患有嗅觉减退症 (hyposmia)。该研究的共同主要作者、格罗斯曼学院教授利奥拉·霍维茨 (Leora Horwitz) 警告说，这种未被察觉的嗅觉丧失会带来安全隐患，例如无法闻到煤气泄漏、烟雾或变质食物，甚至可能导致营养不良。
基于这些发现，研究人员现在建议医生对新冠长期症状患者进行嗅觉测试。即使这些患者没有主动报告任何嗅觉问题，也应进行筛查以评估潜在风险。

original_title: Silver trains social work students with virtual simulations
english_summary: A study from NYU's Silver School of Social Work has found that hybrid training models using virtual simulations can help address New York City's shortage of mental health professionals. The pilot initiative, which began in 2023, allowed social work students to practice clinical interactions in a low-stakes, non-harmful environment before working with actual clients. This training method is particularly useful as it helps students build practical skills that are difficult to practice during internships due to patient confidentiality policies. The study was initiated in response to a 15.6% vacancy rate for mental health provider roles in the city. While students found the simulations helpful, many also felt anxious with automated feedback, indicating the technology requires further development. Silver is now collaborating with NYU's Tandon and Steinhardt schools to launch a fully AI-powered virtual reality simulation this spring.
chinese_title: NYU推出虚拟模拟，应对心理健康人才荒
refined_chinese_news_report:
纽约大学Silver社会工作学院 (NYU's Silver School of Social Work) 的一项研究发现，采用虚拟模拟的混合培训模式，有助于解决纽约市心理健康专业人员短缺的问题。该研究旨在应对市内心理健康服务提供者岗位高达15.6%的空缺率。
这个试点项目于2023年启动，让社会工作专业的学生能在低风险环境中练习临床互动，为接触真实客户做准备。这种训练方式弥补了实习的不足，因为在实习中，学生常因患者保密政策而难以获得充分的实践机会。
尽管学生们认为模拟训练有帮助，但许多人对自动化反馈感到焦虑，这表明该技术仍需完善。目前，Silver学院正与纽约大学的Tandon工程学院和Steinhardt学院合作，计划在今年春天推出一个完全由人工智能驱动的虚拟现实模拟系统。

original_title: Urban health care can’t keep up, Tandon study finds
english_summary: A September study from NYU's Tandon School of Engineering found that the number of medical specialists in large cities is failing to keep pace with population growth. Led by Tandon Ph.D. candidate Tian Gan, the research analyzed over 1.4 million healthcare providers nationwide. The findings show that New York City, despite offering 74 of 75 tracked specialties, has only 4.7 specialists per 1,000 residents. This shortage results in longer wait times, bounced referrals, and difficulty accessing specialized care, particularly for conditions common in older adults. Consequently, urban residents may need to travel outside their neighborhoods for faster treatment, a practice researchers termed "medical tourism." The study also identified addiction and preventive medicine as the most underrepresented specialties in metropolitan areas.
chinese_title: 纽约大学研究发现，专科医生跟不上人口
refined_chinese_news_report:
纽约大学坦登工程学院 (NYU's Tandon School of Engineering) 九月发布的一项研究指出，大城市专科医生的数量未能跟上人口增长的步伐。该研究由坦登学院博士生甘甜 (Tian Gan) 领导，分析了全美超过140万名医疗服务提供者的数据。
研究以纽约市为例，尽管该市提供75个追踪专科中的74个，但每千名居民仅拥有4.7名专科医生。这种短缺现象导致了更长的候诊时间、转诊被拒，以及难以获得专业护理，对有老年常见病的患者影响尤其严重。
因此，城市居民可能需要前往自己社区以外的地区以寻求更及时的治疗，研究人员将此现象称为“医疗旅行” (medical tourism)。研究还发现，在都会区中，成瘾医学和预防医学是资源最不足的两个专科领域。

original_title: NYU awaits guidance on admissions data release
english_summary: New York University is awaiting federal guidance regarding a new Trump administration mandate requiring universities to submit detailed applicant and admissions data. Beginning December 3, the Department of Education will require four-year institutions to provide six years of data, including applicants' race, sex, test scores, and GPAs. This measure is intended to ensure universities are not using race-based admissions following the Supreme Court's ban on affirmative action. Non-compliance puts NYU at risk of losing up to $1.5 billion in federal funding, which includes research grants and student aid. This policy follows a demographic shift at NYU after the 2023 ban, where Asian student enrollment rose from 22% to 27%, while Black and Latino student enrollment declined. The federal government's increased scrutiny also includes a recent State Department memo recommending that 38 universities be cut from a research program over diversity initiatives, though it is unclear if NYU is on that list.
chinese_title: 美政府严查招生，NYU或损失15亿资助
refined_chinese_news_report:
纽约大学 (NYU) 正在等待联邦政府就一项新规发布指导意见。根据特朗普政府的这项新规，从12月3日起，全美四年制大学必须提交过去六年的详细申请和录取数据，其中包括申请人的种族、性别、标化考试成绩和平均绩点 (GPA)。
此举的目的是确保各大学在最高法院禁止平权法案后，不再进行基于种族的招生。如果纽约大学未能遵守规定，将面临失去高达15亿美元联邦资金的风险，这笔资金涵盖了科研经费和学生援助。
这项政策出台的背景是，自2023年最高法院发布禁令以来，纽约大学的学生构成已发生变化。数据显示，亚裔学生的入学比例从22%上升至27%，而黑人及拉丁裔学生的入学比例则有所下降。此外，美国国务院近期的一份备忘录建议，因其多元化项目，应将38所大学从一项研究计划中移除，但目前尚不清楚纽约大学是否在该名单上。
